intro: Stenostephanus harleyi, commonly known as the Harley's stephanus, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, pale pink or white flowers. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
